page.title: 15Fauna at Durlston
page.content: Wildlife is varied in our study area and includes most small mammals common to the British Isles. RODENTS - Mice, voles, shrews, rats and the grey squirrel. MAMMALS - Badgers have setts in the area and breed well. Foxes too live undisturbed. DEER - Types include roe and sika tracks and droppings can be found. BUTTERFLIES - 33 species can be seen. INSECTS - A variety particularly at Durlston Country Park, due to conservation. REPTILES - Slow worms, grass snakes and lizards can be seen. Also the only poisonous snake of the British Isles the adder.
